proposition: Teeth sealants have become a popular topic of discussion regarding their safety and efficacy in dental care.
Most dentists consider sealants to be safe.

The chemical composition of sealants was not extensively researched in the text.
It is acknowledged that teeth sealants serve as a better alternative to developing deep cavities in teeth.
Sealants are introduced to teeth under certain concentrations and conditions.
The introduction of sealants aims to prevent the need for drilling and filling cavities.
Metal fillings have raised concerns about their safety and potential health risks.
Metal fillings contain substances like lead and silver.
Metal fillings historically contained mercury.
The text highlights the importance of not disrupting metal fillings, especially those containing mercury.
Disrupting metal fillings can liberate the mercury and potentially lead to health issues.
Dentists generally advise against removing metal fillings unless necessary.
Dentists recommend using caution with activities like chewing hard substances that can disrupt the fillings.
